bibl.title: James A. Balch v. J.W. Waughop. Warrant of Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Yakima } ss
IN THE PROBATE COURT OF YAKIMA CO., W.T.
In the matter of the insanity of Warrant of commitment James A. Balch. to insane Hospital & c. Insane
To the Sheriff of Yakima County, Washington Territory, GREETING:

Whereas, James A. Balch has this day been brought before J.A. Navarre, Judge of the Probate Court in and for said Yakima, Co., W.T. charged with being insane upon the application and complaint of David Guilland, and it appearing to the satisfaction of the said Judge that the said James A. Balch is insane and unsafe to be at large. Therefore, in the name of the United States, you are commanded forthwith to carry the said James A. Balch safely to the Hospital for the insane in Washington Territory, near Steilacoom, and place him in charge of the proper officers of said hospital and make return of this writ with your donings thereon.
[Seal of Probate Court of Yakima Co., W.T.]
WITNESS the Hon. J.A. Navarre, Judge of the Probate Court of Yakima County W.T. and the Seal of the said Court affixed this 2nd day of June, 1883
J.A. Navarre, Judge of the Ex-Officio Clerk Probate Court.
In RE James A. Balch, Insane.
Warrant of Commitment to Insane hospital.
